bibl.title: Letter from S. M. Sparkman to George Miller Sternberg, June 8, 1901

div1.p: Sparkman requests 150 to 200 copies of “The Etiology of Yellow Fever” for distribution. He believes several thousand copies should be distributed to southern States.

div1.head: Letter from S. M. Sparkman to George Miller Sternberg, June 8, 1901
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF SURGEON GENERAL
JUN 9
71980
U
1901
WAR DEPARTMENT
Washington, D.C.,
June 8, 1901.
Hon. S. M. Sparkman,
M.C.
Requests at least 150 or
200 additional copies of the
Report on the Etiology of
Yellow Fever. Suggests
that several thousand
copies of this Report be
printed and distributed
in such states as Fla.,
Ala., La. and Miss.
71980
Washington, D.C., June 8, 1901.
Gen. George M. Sternberg,
Surgeon General,
Washington, D.C.
Dear Sir:-
div1.p:
I received from some one in your office to-day the recent re-
port upon the investigation which has been going on in Cuba as to the
causes and transmission of yellow fever. I could only get half a dozen
copies and if you have any others to spare, I will be pleased indeed if
you will send them to my address at Tampa, Fla.

The people in the southern portion, in fact, in all of Florida
are very much interested in this matter and I could send out to advantage
several thousand copies if I had them. I hope you will follow this sug-
gestion and have the Department to print several thousand of these re-
ports and let them be distributed in such States as Florida, Alabama,
Louisiana and Mississippi. Ast the least, I would like to have one hun-
dred and fifty or two hundred copies.
div1.closer: Yours very truly, S. M. Sparkman M.C.
